Welcome to this presentation: Accessibility for
the Capella Learner, presented by Capella's Disability Services Department.
We are glad to have you join us to learn more about accessibility for our learners, including those with disabilities.
Disability Services approves academic accommodations for learners with disabilities and serves as a subject matter expert for faculty and staff.
Our department works to ensure equal access and equal opportunity, adhering to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
After viewing this presentation, we hope you will have a better understanding of our learners with disabilities,...
particularly those using assistive technologies and alternative communication methods to access their courses, the importance of ADA compliance,...
common accessibility issues and steps we can all take to ensure equal access for all our learners.
So just how many learners with disabilities are registered with Capella?
Approximately three to five percent of Capella's total enrollment chooses to register with Disability Services,...
although the total percentage of learners with disabilities enrolled is likely much higher.
It can be difficult to determine an exact number as learners are not required to register with Disability Services...
and the online environment can be more accessible than land-based institutions, eliminating the need for accommodations.
For example, a learner using a wheelchair may choose Capella instead of navigating the University of Minnesota's physical campus.
